title: Sydney smashed by severe flash flooding | 7NEWS
description: Sydney experienced severe flash flooding with more than 100 millimetres of rain falling within three hours, triggering 42 priority rescues and nearly 500 emergency calls. Western suburbs including Fairfield and Lidcombe were among the worst affected, with around a dozen residents evacuated as water surged into homes and streets transformed into rivers. Emergency crews responded to drivers trapped on submerged roads while major routes were shut down during the evening commute. title: Teen charged over Sydney underworld kidnapping | 7NEWS
description: A 16-year-old boy faces court charged over his alleged involvement in an underworld kidnapping in Sydney's west, where four masked men abducted a 53-year-old man outside a tobacconist in Mount Pritchard. The victim was held hostage for two days at a property in Dural before heavily armed police stormed the location. Police continue searching for the four men captured on CCTV during the abduction, with investigators believing the teenager was not among those who carried out the kidnapping. title: US-Iran talks show progress amid military buildup | 7NEWS
description: US and Iran nuclear talks in Geneva have concluded with officials announcing significant progress, though few details have been released. The USS Gerald Ford aircraft carrier has positioned itself off Israel's coast, completing the largest US military buildup in the region since the 2003 Gulf War. Iran has released state television footage of military rehearsals and warned of devastating consequences if the US launches strike action, while both sides await President Donald Trump's response to the negotiation outcomes. title: Chicago honours Reverend Jesse Jackson in memorial procession | 7NEWS
description: Reverend Jesse Jackson's remains were transported through Chicago streets in a procession that ended at Rainbow Push headquarters, the civil rights organisation he founded. Hundreds gathered for the memorial service as family members mourned and the public paid their respects. This marks the first of several memorial services honouring the late civil rights leader. title: Hillary Clinton denies Epstein ties in congressional hearing | 7NEWS
description: Hillary Clinton testified before a congressional committee for six hours, denying any connection to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The former Secretary of State stated she never met Epstein, flew on his plane, or visited his properties, whilst labelling the deposition a political distraction from President Trump's actions. Democrats have called for the release of documents allegedly detailing sexual assault allegations against Donald Trump that were excluded from the publicly released Epstein files, whilst the Department of Justice reviews whether files were improperly withheld. title: Sydney Mardi Gras parade set to dazzle | 7NEWS
description: Sydney's Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade will transform a two-kilometre stretch of Oxford Street into a celebration of diversity and inclusion this weekend. Almost 10,000 marchers and 170 floats will parade from Hyde Park to Moore Park, a route now officially on the National Heritage Register. For the first time, Metro and Rail services will run 24 hours to transport partygoers throughout the night. title: Harry and Meghan wrap Jordan refugee visit | 7NEWS
description: Prince Harry and Meghan completed a two-day visit to Jordan, invited by the World Health Organisation to highlight the work of international agencies assisting refugees. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited a cancer centre in Amman, a rehabilitation facility, and refugee camps where they met children evacuated from Gaza. Jordan hosts one of the world's highest refugee populations at approximately 10% of its total population. title: Teenager rescued from 30-metre crane in Melbourne | 7NEWS
description: A teenage boy was rescued from a 30-metre-high crane in Heidelberg, Melbourne's north-east, after climbing it to photograph the sunset. His phone battery died and his feet became wet, leaving him unable to safely descend. He threw down a handwritten note with his father's contact details before firefighters from the high angle rescue team brought him down at 10:30pm and reunited him with his family. title: New weight loss pill outperforms Wegovy in diabetes trial | 7NEWS
description: A clinical trial comparing two weight loss tablets for type 2 diabetes patients shows orforglipron, manufactured by Eli Lilly, outperformed Wegovy in both blood sugar control and weight reduction. Over 12 months, participants taking orforglipron lost 6-8% of their body weight compared to 4-5% with oral semaglutide, though orforglipron caused more gastrointestinal side effects. The medication is still under regulatory review and awaiting approval for use in Australia. title: Breastfeeding breakthrough protects mothers and babies | 7NEWS
description: Breastfeeding protects mothers from breast cancer and improves immunity in babies, according to new US research. Scientists discovered that white blood cells known as T-cells support milk production and provide lasting benefits for maternal and infant growth and immune development. The research team is calling for further investigation into the effects of lactation on immunology. title: Commonwealth Bank investigates $1 billion AI fraud crisis | 7NEWS
description: The Commonwealth Bank is investigating up to $1 billion in potentially fraudulent home loans involving AI-generated forgeries, as major Australian companies including Afterpay and WiseTech announce thousands of job cuts due to AI automation. Professor Toby Walsh from UNSW's AI Institute warns that Australia lacks adequate regulations to protect against AI-related harms, despite the technology's growing influence across financial services, employment, and military applications. The discussion covers the urgent need for regulatory frameworks, workforce reskilling, and international safeguards as AI systems demonstrate increasingly concerning capabilities in warfare simulations. title: Knights fans take over Las Vegas for season opener | 7NEWS
description: Newcastle Knights halfback Dylan Brown is preparing for his club debut at the NRL season opener in Las Vegas, where thousands of dedicated Knights supporters have travelled to show their support. The fan turnout at events like Ausfest at Resorts World has energised the team ahead of their match, with Brown acknowledging the significant sacrifice fans have made to attend. The Knights are focused on securing two competition points in their opening round match. title: Australians buying cars and houses on social media | 7NEWS
description: Social media platforms are driving major purchasing decisions among Australians, with one in five buying big-ticket items including cars (10%), expensive jewellery, art, and houses (3%) through these channels. Money expert Rebecca Pike from Finder warns buyers to conduct thorough due diligence and inspections, particularly when using platforms like Facebook Marketplace, to avoid scams. Pike recommends avoiding purchases after dark, implementing a 24-hour rule before buying, and transferring money that would have been impulsively spent into a dedicated savings account. title: ASX 200 reaches highs as February delivers strong gains | 7NEWS
description: The ASX 200 continues trading near all-time highs, lifting 0.1% to close February with its strongest monthly performance since May last year, up 3.5%. Block's shares surged 30% following workforce reduction announcements, while retail giants Coles and Harvey Norman fell 8% and 7% respectively due to disappointing earnings. The Australian dollar maintains strength above 71 US cents, reaching three-year highs. title: Dolly Parton hospital honour and Oscar presenters announced | 7NEWS
description: East Tennessee Children's Hospital is being renamed Dolly Parton Children's Hospital in recognition of the country music star's nearly 40 years of charitable work through her Dollywood Foundation. The 98th annual Academy Awards has announced new presenters including Chris Evans, Chase Infiniti, Demi Moore, Kumail Nanjiani and Maya Rudolph. Swedish supergroup ABBA's 1977 concert at Sydney Showground, featured in ABBA The Movie, sparked widespread ABBA-mania across Australia during their first and only tour of the country.
